revised_title: Damp Air in Coal Pits: A Study on Coal Mining and Gas Emission
tldr: This article describes a case study of a coal pit near the sea where the workers encountered damp, corrupted air that ignited when exposed to fire. The author, Sir James Lowther, explains the experiments conducted to control and manage the gas emissions, including the use of a tube to release the damp air safely. The findings were presented to the Royal Society.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Mining and Mineral Resources
